title: Justification for Victims of Trolling
body:
So I would just like to start off with, on face value, League of Legends is a great game. The mechanics are fun, the champions are fun to play and the items makes things different.

However, it is also a terrible game in terms of community. I would rank just more toxic than Call of Duty.

As of today, every game I have played has had someone AFK, intentionally feed or intentionally throw because they lost their game. 

Now I know a lot of you will try to justify this trolling because in reality, if Riot knew that they had a real trolling issue, many of you will face the ban hammer so to speak so I will explain what they do. 

- AFK for multiple extended periods of time
- Mouth of to everyone because they accept it is their fault
- Repeatedly turret dive for the soul purpose of feeding
- Running around in base trying to beat the leavebusters

And before you say anything, no I haven't said anything back. My attitude has been "well if I keep trying to be good, hopefully karma will reward me". It hasn't and the trolls keep on coming.

So what I am wondering is, is there a list you are put on randomly and temporarily in the match making system in order to help dilate the toxicity of the game?

replies.body: I had stupid trolls ruin my placements, dropping me from a Gold V MMR to a Silver II one... Now I've just given up. I'm never going to achieve my League goals, so why bother?
Don't give up, add me and we can climb together, the more people you queue, with the less trolls in a game

Dont bother with the like of him. Making weak excuse why he cant reach his goal; When the bottom line is he gave up on it. 

@Challenger Zoe Competitive things isnt for you. With the way you so readily given up when you hit an obstacle. For all we know you could just be shi-t at the game. and using luck as an excuse.
Now see, this is the kinda toxicity which gives people this opinion

No, this is the real world. If you dont have the talent then work harder. If you suck at something and you want to get better, then improve with good practices. When you have the mentality of this guy up above, you are already doom to live a life of failurer. This is not toxic but a simple truth. If you think am being toxic, then too bad. Reality is not kind to those who blame luck and dont try.

I just think you've been unlucky, I have had an actually pretty good season of no one being toxic, they have been very toxic people every now and then but most of them say sorry when you just don't harass them back.

I haven't had anyone be externally toxic so far this pre-season.

I've had people go afk, sure sometimes there are reasons.
Like someone just kicked down there door and is holding a gun to their heads.
Or they just got a phone call saying someone in the family died.

Or becuase they DC'ed or decided to poop halfway through a game.
Who knows.

The closest thing Ive seen "INTing" in pre-season, was when some guy on my team started following everyone around saying "lets go get them" "lets try our hardest", "I'm going to engage in ok?" 

While not casting any spells or attacking, literally walking into the enemy and not caring.
